detaileddescription.para: Standard size of buffer and max node size.
Word size used during RS encoding.
Token returned when FTI performs a checkpoint.
Token returned if a FTI function succeeds.
Token returned if a FTI function fails.
Token returned if recovery fails.
Token that indicates a head process in user space
status 'failed' for stage requests
status 'succeed' for stage requests
status 'active' for stage requests
status 'pending' for stage requests
status 'not initialized' for stage requests
MPI communicator that splits the global one into app and FTI appart.
FTI data type for chars.
FTI data type for short integers.
FTI data type for integers.
FTI data type for long integers.
FTI data type for unsigned chars.
FTI data type for unsigned short integers.
FTI data type for unsigned integers.
FTI data type for unsigned long integers.
FTI data type for single floating point.
FTI data type for double floating point.
FTI data type for long doble floating point.

briefdescription.para: Initializes FTI.

detaileddescription.para:
configFile
FTI configuration file.
globalComm
Main MPI communicator of the application.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function initializes the FTI context and prepares the heads to wait for checkpoints. FTI processes should never get out of this function. In case of a restart, checkpoint files should be recovered and in place at the end of this function.

briefdescription.para: It returns the current status of the recovery flag.

detaileddescription.para:
integer FTI_Exec.reco.
This function returns the current status of the recovery flag.

briefdescription.para: It initializes a data type.

detaileddescription.para:
type
The data type to be intialized.
size
The size of the data type to be intialized.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function initalizes a data type. The only information needed is the size of the data type, the rest is black box for FTI. Types saved as byte array in case of HDF5 format.

memberdef.argsstring: (FTIT_type *newType, FTIT_complexType *typeDefinition, int length, size_t size, char *name, FTIT_H5Group *h5group)
memberdef.name: FTI_InitComplexType

briefdescription.para: It initializes a complex data type.

detaileddescription.para:
newType
The data type to be intialized.
typeDefinition
Structure definition of the new type.
length
Number of fields in structure
size
Size of the structure.
name
Name of the structure.
h5group
Group of the type.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function initalizes a simple data type. New type can only consists fields of flat FTI types (no arrays). Type definition must include:
length => number of fields in the new type
field[].type => types of the field in the new type
field[].name => name of the field in the new type
field[].rank => number of dimentions of the field
field[].dimLength[] => length of each dimention of the field

memberdef.argsstring: (FTIT_complexType *typeDefinition, FTIT_type *ftiType, size_t offset, int id, char *name)
memberdef.name: FTI_AddSimpleField

briefdescription.para: It adds a simple field in complex data type.

detaileddescription.para:
typeDefinition
Structure definition of the complex data type.
ftiType
Type of the field
offset
Offset of the field (use offsetof)
id
Id of the field (start with 0)
name
Name of the field (put NULL if want default)
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function adds a field to the complex datatype. Use offsetof macro to set offset. First ID must be 0, next one must be +1. If name is NULL FTI will set "T${id}" name. Sets rank and dimLength to 1.

memberdef.argsstring: (FTIT_complexType *typeDefinition, FTIT_type *ftiType, size_t offset, int rank, int *dimLength, int id, char *name)
memberdef.name: FTI_AddComplexField

briefdescription.para: It adds a simple field in complex data type.

detaileddescription.para:
typeDefinition
Structure definition of the complex data type.
ftiType
Type of the field
offset
Offset of the field (use offsetof)
rank
Rank of the array
dimLength
Dimention length for each rank
id
Id of the field (start with 0)
name
Name of the field (put NULL if want default)
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function adds a field to the complex datatype. Use offsetof macro to set offset. First ID must be 0, next one must be +1. If name is NULL FTI will set "T${id}" name.

briefdescription.para: It initialize a HDF5 group.

detaileddescription.para:
h5group
H5 group that we want to initialize
name
Name of the H5 group
parent
Parent H5 group
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
Initialize group defined by user. If parent is NULL this mean parent will be set to root group.

briefdescription.para: Renames a HDF5 group.

detaileddescription.para:
h5group
H5 group that we want to rename
name
New name of the H5 group
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function renames HDF5 group defined by user.

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, void *ptr, long count, FTIT_type type)
memberdef.name: FTI_Protect

briefdescription.para: It sets/resets the pointer and type to a protected variable.

detaileddescription.para:
id
ID for searches and update.
ptr
Pointer to the data structure.
count
Number of elements in the data structure.
type
Type of elements in the data structure.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function stores a pointer to a data structure, its size, its ID, its number of elements and the type of the elements. This list of structures is the data that will be stored during a checkpoint and loaded during a recovery. It resets the pointer to a data structure, its size, its number of elements and the type of the elements if the dataset was already previously registered.

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, int rank, int *dimLength, char *name, FTIT_H5Group *h5group)
memberdef.name: FTI_DefineDataset

briefdescription.para: Defines the dataset.

detaileddescription.para:
id
ID for searches and update.
rank
Rank of the array
dimLength
Dimention length for each rank
name
Name of the dataset in HDF5 file.
h5group
Group of the dataset. If Null then "/"
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function gives FTI all information needed by HDF5 to correctly save the dataset in the checkpoint file.

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, int rank, FTIT_hsize_t *dimLength, const char *name, FTIT_H5Group *h5group, FTIT_type type)
memberdef.name: FTI_DefineGlobalDataset

briefdescription.para: Defines a global dataset (shared among application processes)

detaileddescription.para:
id
ID of the dataset.
rank
Rank of the dataset.
dimLength
Dimention length for each rank.
name
Name of the dataset in HDF5 file.
h5group
Group of the dataset. If Null then "/".
type
FTI type of the dataset.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function defines a global dataset which is shared among all ranks. In order to assign sub sets to the dataset the user has to call the function 'FTI_AddSubset'. The parameter 'did' of that function, corres- ponds to the global dataset id define here.

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, int rank, FTIT_hsize_t *offset, FTIT_hsize_t *count, int did)
memberdef.name: FTI_AddSubset

briefdescription.para: Assigns a FTI protected variable to a global dataset.

detaileddescription.para:
id
Corresponding variable ID.
rank
Rank of the dataset.
offset
Starting coordinates in global dataset.
count
number of elements for each coordinate.
did
Corresponding global dataset ID.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function assigns the protected dataset with ID 'id' to a global data- set with ID 'did'. The parameters 'offset' and 'count' specify the selec- tion of the sub-set inside the global dataset ('offset' and 'count' cor- respond to 'start' and 'count' in the HDF5 function 'H5Sselect_hyperslab' For questions on what they define, please consult the HDF5 documentation.)

briefdescription.para: loads dataset dimension from ckpt file to dataset 'did'
returns static array of dataset dimensions
returns rank of shared dataset
Updates global dataset (shared among application processes)

detaileddescription.para:
id
ID of the dataset.
rank
Rank of the dataset.
dimLength
Dimention length for each rank.
updates only the rank and number of elements for each coordinate direction.

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, int rank, FTIT_hsize_t *offset, FTIT_hsize_t *count, int did)
memberdef.name: FTI_UpdateSubset

briefdescription.para: Updates a FTI protected variable of a global dataset.

parameterdescription.para: number of elements for each coordinate.

briefdescription.para: Returns size saved in metadata of variable.

detaileddescription.para:
id
Variable ID.
long Returns size of variable or 0 if size not saved.
This function returns size of variable of given ID that is saved in metadata. This may be different from size of variable that is in the program. If this function it's called when recovery it returns size from metadata file, if it's called after checkpoint it returns size saved in temporary metadata. If there is no size saved in metadata it returns 0.

briefdescription.para: Reallocates dataset to last checkpoint size.

simplesect.para: ptr Pointer if successful, NULL otherwise This function loads the checkpoint data size from the metadata file, reallacates memory and updates data size information.

briefdescription.para: Bit-flip injection following the injection instructions.

detaileddescription.para:
datasetID
ID of the dataset where to inject.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function injects the given number of bit-flips, at the given frequency and in the given location (rank, dataset, bit position).

briefdescription.para: It takes the checkpoint and triggers the post-ckpt. work.

detaileddescription.para:
id
Checkpoint ID.
level
Checkpoint level.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function starts by blocking on a receive if the previous ckpt. was offline. Then, it updates the ckpt. information. It writes down the ckpt. data, creates the metadata and the post-processing work. This function is complementary with the FTI_Listen function in terms of communications.

briefdescription.para: Places the FTI staging directory path into 'stageDir'.

detaileddescription.para:
stageDir
pointer to allocated memory region.
maxLen
size of allocated memory region in bytes.
integer FTI_SCES if successful, FTI_NSCS else.
This function places the FTI staging directory path in 'stageDir'. If allocation size is not sufficiant, no action is perfoprmed and FTI_NSCS is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns status of staging request.

detaileddescription.para:
ID
ID of staging request.
integer Status of staging request on success, FTI_NSCS else.
This function returns the status of the staging request corresponding to ID. The ID is returned by the function 'FTI_SendFile'. The status may be one of the five possible statuses:

simplesect.para: FTI_SI_FAIL - Stage request failed FTI_SI_SCES - Stage request succeed FTI_SI_ACTV - Stage request is currently processed FTI_SI_PEND - Stage request is pending FTI_SI_NINI - There is no stage request with this ID

If the status is FTI_SI_NINI, the ID is either invalid or the request was finished (succeeded or failed). In the latter case, 'FTI_GetStageStatus' returns FTI_SI_FAIL or FTI_SI_SCES and frees the stage request ressources. In the consecutive call it will then return FTI_SI_NINI.

briefdescription.para: Copies file asynchronously from 'lpath' to 'rpath'.

detaileddescription.para:
lpath
absolute path local file.
rpath
absolute path remote file.
integer Request handle (ID) on success, FTI_NSCS else.
This function may be used to copy a file local on the nodes via the FTI head process asynchronously to the PFS. The file will not be removed after successful transfer, however, if stored in the directory returned by 'FTI_GetStageDir' it will be removed during 'FTI_Finalize'.

simplesect.para: If staging is enabled but no head process, the staging will be performed synchronously (i.e. by the calling rank).

briefdescription.para: It loads the checkpoint data.

detaileddescription.para:
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function loads the checkpoint data from the checkpoint file and it updates some basic checkpoint information.

briefdescription.para: Takes an FTI snapshot or recovers the data if it is a restart.

detaileddescription.para:
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function loads the checkpoint data from the checkpoint file in case of restart. Otherwise, it checks if the current iteration requires checkpointing, if it does it checks which checkpoint level, write the data in the files and it communicates with the head of the node to inform that a checkpoint has been taken. Checkpoint ID and counters are updated.

briefdescription.para: It closes FTI properly on the application processes.

detaileddescription.para:
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function notifies the FTI processes that the execution is over, frees some data structures and it closes. If this function is not called on the application processes the FTI processes will never finish (deadlock).

briefdescription.para: During the restart, recovers the given variable.

detaileddescription.para:
id
Variable to recover
int FTI_SCES if successful.
During a restart process, this function recovers the variable specified by the given id. No effect during a regular execution. The variable must have already been protected, otherwise, FTI_NSCS is returned. Improvements to be done:
Open checkpoint file at FTI_Init, close it at FTI_Snapshot
Maintain a variable accumulating the offset as variable are protected during the restart to avoid doing the loop to calculate the offset in the checkpoint file.

briefdescription.para: Initialize an incremental checkpoint.

detaileddescription.para:
id
Checkpoint ID.
level
Checkpoint level.
activate
Boolean expression.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function defines the environment for the incremental checkpointing mechanism. The iCP mechanism consists of three functions: FTI_InitICP, FTI_AddVarICP and FTI_FinalizeICP. The two functions FTI_InitICP and FTI_FinalizeICP define the iCP region within the user may write the protected variables in any order. The iCP region is active, when the expression passed through 'activate' evaluates to TRUE.

simplesect.para: This function is not blocking for POSIX, FTI-FF and HDF5, but, blocking for MPI-IO. This is due to the collective open call in MPI_IO

briefdescription.para: Write variable into the CP file.

detaileddescription.para:
id
Protected variable ID.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
With this function, the user may write the protected datasets in any order into the checkpoint file. However, before the call to FTI_FinalizeICP, all protected variables must have been written into the file.

briefdescription.para: Finalize an incremental checkpoint.

detaileddescription.para:
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function finalizes an incremental checkpoint. In contrast to InitICP, this function is collective on the communicator FTI_COMM_WORLD and blocking.

briefdescription.para: Searches in the protected variables for a name. If not found it allocates and returns the ID.

detaileddescription.para:
name
Name of the protected variable to search
integer id of the variable.
This function searches for a given name in the protected variables and returns the respective id for it.

briefdescription.para: Searches in the protected variables for a name. If not found it allocates and returns the ID.

detaileddescription.para:
name
Name of the protected variable to search
integer id of the variable.
This function searches for a given name in the protected variables and returns the respective id for it.

briefdescription.para: Header file for the FTI library.
